conclusion: Understanding the flow of liquid through baffles to containers E and F.
Image 1 shows initial setup with baffles labeled A, B, C, and D where liquid is poured.
Image 2 shows liquid flowing through baffles, directed into specific paths, with colors helping track flow.
Image 3 shows final state where liquid has flowed into containers E and F.
Liquid from baffle A is directed towards container E.
Liquid from baffle B is directed towards container F.
Liquid from baffle C is directed towards container E.
Liquid from baffle D is directed towards container F.
Liquid from baffles A and C will flow into container E.
Liquid from baffles B and D will flow into container F.
Final answer: Container E receives liquid from baffles A and C; Container F receives liquid from baffles B and D.
